citations.desc: Primary enclosures used to transport live birds.
citations.narrative:
An adult red-tailed hawk was being shipped from PHL to MSP (Air Waybill # 006 PHL 86542433) in a primary enclosure
that had all four sides obscured with two layers of cloth and fabric mesh. The two layers of mesh prevented a carrier from
observing the animal without removing said layers of mesh during transportation. The two layers of mesh also prevented
the animal from getting proper ventilation. Inadequate ventilation can result in an animal over-heating or experiencing
other health risks. The registrant must ensure that any visually obscuring mesh used to provide security for the bird in the
enclosure must not interfere with proper ventilation.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with airline representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
Kira Wagner, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
3.162(b)(3) 
   
Primary enclosures used to transport live birds. 
An adult red-tailed hawk was being shipped from PHL to MSP (Air Waybill # 006 PHL 86542433) in a primary enclosure 
that had all four sides obscured with two layers of cloth and fabric mesh. The two layers of mesh prevented a carrier from 
observing the animal without removing said layers of mesh during transportation. The two layers of mesh also prevented 
the animal from getting proper ventilation. Inadequate ventilation can result in an animal over-heating or experiencing 
other health risks. The registrant must ensure that any visually obscuring mesh used to provide security for the bird in the 
enclosure must not interfere with proper ventilation. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with airline representatives. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Kira Wagner, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
